mdRecord.dcterms:title: Saint Christopher's By the Sea Episcopal Church, exterior
mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Wilson, Richard Guy [photographer]
mdRecord.dcterms:publisher: Rector and Visitors of the University of Virginia
mdRecord.dcterms:description: In 1891, a proposal was made to build a summer Episcopal chapel, to be known as St. Christopher's by the Sea, on Grindstone Neck in Winter Harbor, Maine. St. Christopher's seats about 100 people. The interior of the church is rustic in appearance with exposed beams and shingled walls. Memorial plaques have been placed on the walls commemorating the lives of many former worshippers in the church. An example is a lovely carved wooden panel, circa 1509-1511, of Christ accompanied by two of his disciples. http://www.episcopalmaine.org/index.php?option=com_content&view=article&id=91:winter-harbor&catid=35:maps [work]
mdRecord.dcterms:subject: Architecture and City Planning

mdRecord.dcterms:spatial: 9 Clubhouse Lane, Winter Harbor, Hancock, Maine, United States
